JobFullDesc: In People & Places, we handle all things people-related so our employees around the globe are empowered to do their best work. Our Talent Acquisition teams find, attract, and hire the world’s greatest minds to join Uber.    About the RoleAt Uber, we pride ourselves on the amazing team we’ve built. Delivering a first-class, on-demand customer experience takes a critical eye for quality, and we are looking for a Senior PhD University Recruiter - Talent Advisor that has the same critical eye. Our recruiters must be able to hire the best talent while delivering elite candidate and partner experience. Come join our University Talent Acquisition team as a Talent Advisor where you’ll execute strategies that drive the hiring of PhD interns and New Grads across Uber’s Tech organizations. The right person for this role will love connecting with PhD students to excite them about the work, culture, and impact of Uber while also establishing trust with business partners of various levels to advise on best practices that result in making strong university hires. A successful person in this role will utilize their business acumen and effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to influence multiple partners and hire top talent in a fast-paced environment. What You’ll Do: Partner with leadership on driving PhD hiring initiatives, mapping out headcount, and driving closing processManage relationships across multiple Uber teams in different locationsProactively communicate and collaborate with Talent Scouts to effectively run candidate pipeline healthAnalyze pipeline metrics to ensure hiring needs are metLead the reporting of key performance recruiting metrics and identify trends.Drive partnerships with multiple business partners, including various teams within People & PlacesDemonstrate working knowledge of market trends and competitor best practices while delivering an outstanding candidate experienceBe hyper-knowledgeable about our business and be on point for offer negotiation and HR-related questions (i.e., benefits, comp, etc).Work to improve upon existing processes and develop innovative approaches around finding our future crew.Actively participate in intern program activities to maintain candidate engagement and ultimately increase intern conversion   Basic Qualifications: 5+ years of professional experience   Preferred Qualifications: 3+ years of experience in recruiting related functions: recruiting, sourcing, recruiting coordination, or program management of a similar size and scale to UberUniversity recruiting experience, PhD or Graduate recruiting experience, higher education, or career services experienceExperience in a fast-paced, high demand environment4-year degree or equivalent work experienceTechnically savvy, with iCIMS or other ATS experience preferred
